content.description: Start with your hands in almost a compression move with the right in the divot on its side and left along the edge of the south west face. Get your feet into the depression about a foot up and extend up to catch the sloping right side of the edge for the crux. Anyone under 5' 10" might have to dyno it. Get your feet and pull up from there for the topout.
content.location: Route runs up the south edge of the rock.

content.description: Start with your feet on the ground and right jand hand jammed between the boulder and rock next to it. Use the jam to move up and try and keep in it for as long as you can.
content.location: On the north west side of the boulder. Starting in the rockpile.

content.description: Located just north of the small cemetery at the Junction of 22nd Ave. SE and 67th St SE about 7 miles south of Kintyre, ND. A 12 foot granite boulder located a few hundred feet from the road at the south east end of a farmer's rockpile.
